reviews.review_msg: Super super super nice lady. Extremely incompetent prof. Memorize slides/summaries of readings and spew it out on exams/papers; you don't need to show understanding of any kind just write as much BS as you can and you get handed an A+! So weird but it works.
Tough homework assignments, would advise asking for help on these. Other than that attend all classes and you should get a great grade.
He is great nowadays. He is underrated here.

Lectures consistent of student presentations of an article every week and the rest of the class is him talking about a subject he wants to. Things were not well organized, and hard to study for. An 80 was considered a C and we did not know this at all. He is a very nice guy though and I liked him as a person. Though over all not a very hard class.

He's a good guy, unfortunately not in COGS himself so he can't speak to a lot of the CS or Psyc topics, engaging and teaches well though. Vague in marking as everyone else says but you can also just ask him questions over email or before/after class and he will answer. He's reasonable and if you have issues with group mates you can talk to him.

Good lecturer, frequent class discussions and group work are interesting and fun. However he is very unclear on his marking scheme. You can get Bs and As on all midterms and presentations based on his scheme and end up with a C- final grade - other components supposidly being worth a combined 20%. States this is standard practice.
